attributes.comment:
The adjustment of the Immigration and Naturalization Benefit Application and
Petition Fee is a measure that discriminate poeple who cannot afford this
increase. Many petitioners have to save up money for years before they can
apply: to do so, they have to live in difficult conditions and are abused also. There
have been many increases and none have taken into account the reality of being
an immigrant in this country. Low paying jobs, discrimination, lack of proper
education, low health literacy and the list could take many many pages are all
challenges in our lives. The cost of life has increased for all, but immigrants suffer
unecessarily more than any other, having to make it here and to support families
in their countries as well.
Please reconsider this ADJUSTMENT!! It's harsh and unecssary! Although your
proposal about making the USCIS more funtional is well written, why do we have
to be the ones to pay for it all. All the country benefits for having immigrants: we
work, pay takes, and contribute to the strenght of the ecomomy. Beside , pushing
people into clandestinity is a poor form of fighting it and have never been proven
efficient.
Thank you

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Joyce Diop
